Name: WHIM syndrome
Definition: An immunodeficiency disease that is characterized by neutropenia

Name: lymphoproliferative syndrome
Definition: A primary immunodeficiency disease characterized by immune dysregulation typically after viral infection

Name: familial cold autoinflammatory syndrome
Definition: A primary immunodeficiency disease characterized by recurrent episodes of maculopapular skin rash triggered by exposure to cold associated with low-grade fever

Name: T cell deficiency
Definition: A primary immunodeficiency disease that is characterized by decreased numbers of circulating or functioning T cells.

Name: Nezelof syndrome
Definition: A primary immunodeficiency disease that results from the disfunction or underdevelopment of the thymus.

Name: obsolete perinatal digestive system disorder
Definition: A primary immunodeficiency disease that results from the disfunction or underdevelopment of the thymus.

Name: B cell deficiency
Definition: A primary immunnodeficiency disease that is caused by a lack of infection-fighting antibody producing B cells (immunoglobulins) or B cells that are not functioning properly.

Name: phagocyte bactericidal dysfunction
Definition: A primary immunodeficiency disease where phagocytes have a diminished ability to fight bacterial infection.

Name: complement deficiency
Definition: A primary immunodeficiency disease that is the result in a mutation of a gene encoding one of the thirty complement system proteins

Name: combined T cell and B cell immunodeficiency
Definition: A primary immunodeficiency disease that involves multiple components of the immune system
